meanings.definition: To inquire impertinently or unnecessarily into something
meanings.sent1: She pried into her friend's diary, which was not polite.
meanings.sent2: The detective pried for information about the case.
meanings.sent3: He pried into the secret recipe, hoping to uncover the mystery ingredient.
meanings.sent4: Curiosity pried at her, urging her to ask more questions.
meanings.sent5: The nosy neighbor pried into everyone's business, causing gossip to spread.

meanings.definition: To move or force, especially in an effort to get something open
meanings.sent1: He pried the stuck drawer open with a lot of effort.
meanings.sent2: The crowbar was used to pry open the rusty lock.
meanings.sent3: She pried the lid off the jar, eager to taste the homemade jam.
meanings.sent4: His determination pried the door open, revealing a hidden room.
meanings.sent5: The curious cat pried open the box, revealing a surprise inside.

meanings.definition: To look closely or curiously; peer; peep
meanings.sent1: She pried through the keyhole to see who was outside.
meanings.sent2: The children pried at the window to catch a glimpse of the parade.
meanings.sent3: He pried through the fence to watch the puppies play.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel pried into the bird feeder, searching for seeds.
meanings.sent5: The explorer pried through the dense foliage, searching for hidden ruins.
